ICLI 2016 Programme


Wednesday, June 29th

09:30 - Coffee and pastries (ACCA café)
10:00 - Magnetic Resonator Piano Workshop (ACCA)
10:00 - Halldorophone Workshop (ACCA)
10:00 - Doctoral Colloquium (Sussex Humanities Lab)

  • Ellen Pearlman: Is There A Place In Human Consciousness Where Surveillance Cannot Go? Noor: A Brain Opera [PDF]
  • Dom Brown: Doctoral Colloquium: The Application of Established Gestural Languages in the Control Mappings of Free-hand Gestural Musical Instruments [PDF]
  • Fiona Keenan: A Theatre Wind Machine as Interactive Sounding Object [PDF]
  • Ryan Kirkbride: FoxDot: Live Coding with Python and SuperCollider [PDF]
  • Winnie Soon: Interfacing with questions: The unpredictability of live queries in the work of 'Thousand Questions' [PDF]
  • Richard Burn: Music-making for the Deaf: Exploring new ways of enhancing musical experience with visual and haptic feedback systems [PDF]
  • Ivo Teixeira, Pedro Tudela, and Miguel Carvalhais: Augmented Space in Artistic Production: The Relationship Between Moving Image and Physical Environments [PDF]
  • Danny Bright: Sonic Ghosting: developing an interface between space/place/memory and sound/music/noise [PDF]
  • Jānis Garančs: 'Vivisecting' tempo-spatial semantics in immersive environments and hybrid events: Few methodologies for '3D VJs' and 'VR conductors' [PDF]
  • Shelly Knotts: Algorithmic Interfaces for Collaborative Improvisation [PDF]

    13:00 - Lunch (ACCA café)
    15:30 - Tea/coffee (ACCA café)
